name: Other applicant not applied for a final order (solicitor)
body:
Case number: ((reference number))
Applicant 1: ((applicant name))
Applicant 2: ((respondent name))
Your reference: ((solicitor reference))

Dear ((solicitor name))

The other applicant has not yet applied for a final order. They have to apply before the ((isDivorce??marriage))((isDissolution??civil partnership)) can be legally ended because this is a joint application. 

#What you can do 
 The quickest way to ((isDivorce??finalise the divorce))((isDissolution??end the civil partnership)) is for the other applicant((partner is represented??'s solicitor)) to confirm the joint application for a final order. They have been emailed a reminder to do this. 

If you do not think they will confirm the application then you can apply for a final order as a sole applicant, on behalf of your client.  

First you will need to confirm that you are intending to make the application. The court will then serve notice on the other applicant. If they do not object or ask the court to delay the issuing of the final order then you will be able to make a sole application for a final order 14 days later.  

You can confirm your client's intention to apply for a final order as a sole applicant in your online account. Sign in and select 'intend to switch a sole FO' : ((signin url))


Divorce and Dissolution
HM Courts & Tribunals Service
divorcecase@justice.gov.uk
0300 303 0642 (Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm)

Your feedback helps improve this service for others: https://www.smartsurvey.co.uk/s/Divorce_Feedback/?pageurl=/email
subject: Other applicant not yet applied for a final order
